poem:
"Idle Folk of Sprig Ludens"

Pearly rain hangs on little girl's laughter,
Her young joy wrung out in a muddy puddle.
A toddler finds his stride, across tyres astraddle,
While his friend scales tree, chasing after.
A chorus of innocent mirth soon shatters – 
Empty swings swaying, whispers rattling the rattle,
The ghost of a nursery, caught in a battle;
Free care's heavy price—their joy, what matters.
